termsSections.title: Terms of Service - Introduction
termsSections.content:
Effective Date: October 26, 2023

Welcome to Dynamic Wallet View! These Terms of Service ('Terms') govern your use of the Dynamic Wallet View application and any related services (collectively, the 'Service'). By accessing or using our Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

termsSections.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
termsSections.content: By using Dynamic Wallet View, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agree to these Terms. If you do not agree with any part of these Terms, you must not use the Service.

termsSections.title: 2. Description of Service
termsSections.content: Dynamic Wallet View is a third-party application designed to provide users with a dashboard to view their Pi Network related metrics, including Pi balance, mining rate, team member information, and node performance. Dynamic Wallet View is not an official Pi Network application and is not a functional wallet. It does not store your private keys. The Service may, however, initiate payment requests through the official Pi App SDK for features such as donations, rewarded ads, and app-to-user payments.

termsSections.title: 3. New Features and Payment Services
termsSections.content:
Dynamic Wallet View includes several new features that interact with Pi Network:

**Wallet Address Display:** The app may display your Pi Network wallet address for reference purposes. This is read-only and does not grant the app access to your funds.

**Payment Cancellation:** Users can cancel pending payments through the app interface. Cancelled payments are refunded to the original sender.

**App-to-User Payments (A2U):** The app may send Pi rewards to users for completing certain actions (e.g., watching ads). These payments follow the official Pi Platform API patterns.

**Rewarded Ads:** Users may watch advertisements to earn Pi rewards. Eligibility is server-validated with a daily cap and cooldown to prevent abuse. Rewards are sent using official Pi APIs and recorded in the Transactions page. No third-party ad networks are used.

**Session Management:** Authentication uses a database-backed session cookie ('session-token', httpOnly). In production we use SameSite=Lax and Secure. We do not expose access tokens to the browser.

**Native Features Detection:** The app detects Pi Browser features to ensure compatibility and optimal functionality.

**Share Functionality:** Users can share the app with others through native sharing features.

termsSections.title: 4. User-Generated Content
termsSections.content: You may have the ability to provide information, such as a display name, biography, or profile picture ('User Content'). You are solely responsible for your User Content and assume all risks associated with use of your User Content. You represent that your User Content will not violate any applicable laws or third-party rights.

termsSections.title: 5. Use of Service
termsSections.content: You agree to use the Service only for its intended purposes and in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of any account information related to your use of the Pi Network when interfacing with any third-party application. You acknowledge that wallet address display is for reference only and does not constitute financial advice.

termsSections.title: 6. Data Accuracy and Mock Data
termsSections.content: Currently, Dynamic Wallet View utilizes mock data for demonstration and development purposes. In a live environment connected to the Pi Network, the accuracy of the data displayed would depend on the information made available by the Pi Network APIs and the data you authorize for access. Dynamic Wallet View does not guarantee the absolute accuracy or timeliness of data that originates from the Pi Network. Wallet address display and payment features require proper Pi Network authentication and permissions.

termsSections.title: 6. Disclaimer of Warranties
termsSections.content: The Service is provided 'as is' and 'as available' without any warranties of any kind, express or implied. Dynamic Wallet View does not warrant that the Service will be uninterrupted, error-free, or completely secure. Dynamic Wallet View is not affiliated with the Pi Core Team or the Pi Network.

termsSections.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
termsSections.content: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Dynamic Wallet View shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, whether incurred directly or indirectly, or any loss of data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses, resulting from (a) your access to or use of or inability to access or use the Service; (b) any conduct or content of any third party on the Service; or (c) unauthorized access, use, or alteration of your transmissions or content, even if Dynamic Wallet View has been advised of the possibility of such damages.

termsSections.title: 8. Intellectual Property
termsSections.content: The Dynamic Wallet View name, logo, and all related names, logos, product and service names, designs, and slogans are trademarks of Dynamic Wallet View or its licensors. Pi Network and the Pi logo are trademarks of the Pi Community Company. This Service is not endorsed by or affiliated with the Pi Network.

termsSections.title: 9. Changes to Terms
termsSections.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. We will endeavor to provide notice of any significant changes. Your continued use of the Service after such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms.

termsSections.title: 10. Session & Cookies
termsSections.content: We use a secure, httpOnly session cookie ('session-token') to keep you signed in. In production we set SameSite=Lax and Secure. If your app and API run under different domains, SameSite=None; Secure would be required.

privacySections.title: Privacy Policy - Introduction
privacySections.content:
Effective Date: October 26, 2023

Dynamic Wallet View ('we', 'us', or 'our') is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle information when you use our Dynamic Wallet View application (the 'Service').

privacySections.title: 1. Our Relationship with Pi Network
privacySections.content: Dynamic Wallet View is an independent, third-party application. It is NOT an official application of the Pi Network or the Pi Core Team. This policy describes data handling by Dynamic Wallet View, not by the Pi Network itself. For Pi Network's privacy practices, please refer to their official privacy policy.

privacySections.title: 2. Information We Handle
privacySections.content:
When you use Dynamic Wallet View, the application is designed to display information related to your Pi Network account, which may include:
- Your Pi balance and its breakdown (e.g., transferable, unverified, lockups).
- Your current Pi mining rate.
- Your Pi Network wallet address (for reference and payment purposes).
- Information about your team members (e.g., name, status, contribution), as potentially made available by Pi Network APIs.
- Node performance data (if you are a node operator and this data is accessible).
- Profile information you might provide directly within Dynamic Wallet View (e.g., display name, bio).
- Payment transaction data (for donations, rewards, and app-to-user payments).
- Ad interaction data for rewarded ads (e.g., timestamps and simple counters).
- Session information (a secure session cookie, not your Pi access token).

**Important Note on Current Version:** The current version of Dynamic Wallet View uses MOCK (simulated) DATA for all features. No actual connection to your Pi Network account is made, and no real Pi Network data is fetched or stored by Dynamic Wallet View.

privacySections.title: 3. How We Would Use Information (If Connected to Live Data)
privacySections.content:
If Dynamic Wallet View were connected to live Pi Network data (which it currently is not), the information would be used solely to:
- Provide you with the dashboard features: displaying your Pi-related metrics, team insights, and node analysis.
- Display your wallet address for reference and payment purposes.
- Process payment transactions (donations, rewards, app-to-user payments) using official Pi APIs.
- Enable rewarded ads functionality with server-side validation (daily cap and cooldown) and record rewards in your Transactions.
- Allow you to customize your application experience (e.g., theme, language).
- Detect Pi Browser features for optimal functionality.
- Enable sharing functionality.
We would not sell your personal information. Access to your Pi Network data would require your explicit authorization through Pi Network's official mechanisms.

privacySections.title: 4. Data Storage and Security
privacySections.content: Dynamic Wallet View is designed as a viewer or interface. It would not store sensitive Pi Network data like private keys. Application preferences (theme, language) are stored locally on your device. For rewarded ads, we may store minimal per-user ad view entries (timestamps and basic device/IP hash) solely to enforce caps and cooldowns. Session management uses an httpOnly cookie; access tokens are not exposed to client-side JavaScript.

privacySections.title: 5. Third-Party Services and Advertisements
privacySections.content: Dynamic Wallet View does not share your Pi Network specific data with third-party advertisers. Rewarded ads, when enabled, use only official Pi SDK/API functionality; no third-party ad networks are used.

privacySections.title: 5. Cookies and Sessions
privacySections.content: We use a secure, httpOnly session cookie ('session-token') to keep you signed in. In production we use SameSite=Lax and Secure. If the app and API ever run on different domains, we would switch to SameSite=None; Secure.

privacySections.title: 6. Your Choices and Rights
privacySections.content: Control over your Pi Network data resides with your Pi Network account and its official platform. Dynamic Wallet View, as a third-party viewer, would only display data based on permissions you grant via the Pi Network. Profile information entered directly into Dynamic Wallet View can be managed by you within the app.

privacySections.title: 7. Children's Privacy
privacySections.content: Dynamic Wallet View is not intended for use by children under the age of 13 (or the relevant age in your jurisdiction). We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

privacySections.title: 8. Changes to This Privacy Policy
privacySections.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any significant changes by posting the new Privacy Policy within the application or on our website.

privacySections.title: 9. Contact Us
privacySections.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at privacy@example.com.

helpSections.title: Welcome to Help & Support!
helpSections.content:
**What is Dynamic Wallet View?**
Dynamic Wallet View is a third-party application designed to offer a dynamic and user-friendly interface for viewing your Pi Network related metrics. This includes your Pi balance, current mining rate, insights into your team's activity, and performance data if you operate a Pi Node.

helpSections.title: Is Dynamic Wallet View an official Pi Network App?
helpSections.content: No, Dynamic Wallet View is an independent application developed by enthusiasts. It is not officially affiliated with, endorsed, or sponsored by the Pi Core Team or the Pi Network.

helpSections.title: How accurate is the data shown in Dynamic Wallet View?
helpSections.content: Currently, Dynamic Wallet View uses MOCK (SIMULATED) DATA for all its features. This is for demonstration and development purposes. In a future version intended for live use, data accuracy would depend on the information provided by the official Pi Network APIs and the permissions you grant.

helpSections.title: Key Features Overview
helpSections.content:
*   **Dashboard:** At-a-glance view of your total Pi balance, mining rate, and active team members.
*   **Balance Breakdown:** Detailed view of your Pi balance, including transferable, unverified, and locked-up amounts.
*   **Balance Fluctuation Chart:** Visual representation of your balance changes over time.
*   **Badge Showcase:** Display of earned badges within the Pi Network ecosystem (mocked).
*   **Team Insights:** Information about your team members, their status, and contributions (mocked).
*   **Node Analysis:** For node operators, metrics like uptime and performance score (mocked).
*   **Transaction History:** A complete ledger of your sent, received, and reward transactions.
*   **Lockup & Bonus Calculator:** An interactive tool to estimate mining boosts from locking up Pi.
*   **Team Management Tools:** Engage with your team by pinging inactive members or sending broadcast messages.
*   **Donation Page:** Support the ongoing development of the app.
*   **Settings:** Customize your profile, theme, and notification preferences.
*   **Wallet Address Display:** View and copy your Pi Network wallet address for reference.
*   **Payment Cancellation:** Cancel pending payments and receive refunds.
*   **Rewarded Ads:** Watch advertisements to earn Pi rewards (requires app balance).
*   **Native Features Detection:** Check Pi Browser compatibility and available features.
*   **Share Functionality:** Share the app with others through native sharing.

helpSections.title: New Features Explained
helpSections.content:
**Wallet Address Display:** This feature shows your Pi Network wallet address for reference purposes. It's read-only and doesn't grant the app access to your funds. You can copy the address to share with others or use for receiving Pi.

**Payment Cancellation:** If you have pending payments, you can cancel them through the transactions page. Cancelled payments are automatically refunded to the original sender.

**Rewarded Ads:** Watch short advertisements to earn Pi rewards. These rewards are sent directly to your Pi Network wallet. The app needs sufficient Pi balance (from user donations) to pay rewards.

**Native Features Detection:** The app checks which Pi Browser features are available on your device to ensure optimal functionality.

**Share Functionality:** Use the share button to recommend the app to friends and family.

helpSections.title: Troubleshooting Common Issues
helpSections.content:
*   **App not loading or showing errors:** As Dynamic Wallet View currently uses mock data, persistent errors might indicate a problem with the application itself. Please try refreshing. If issues continue, contact support.
*   **Data seems incorrect:** Remember, all data in this version is simulated. It does not reflect your actual Pi Network account.
*   **Wallet address not showing:** This may be due to insufficient permissions or authentication issues. Ensure you've granted the wallet_address scope during authentication.
*   **Payment cancellation not working:** Payment cancellation is only available for pending payments. Completed or failed payments cannot be cancelled.
*   **Rewarded ads not available:** The app needs sufficient Pi balance to pay rewards. This comes from user donations. If no balance is available, ads will be disabled.
*   **Authentication popup appears multiple times:** This should be fixed in the latest version. If you still see duplicate popups, try refreshing the page.
*   **Mobile display issues:** The app is designed to be responsive. If you see desktop layout on mobile, try refreshing or check your browser settings.

helpSections.title: Contacting Support
helpSections.content:
If you have any questions specific to the Dynamic Wallet View application, encounter bugs, or have feedback, please email us at support@example.com.

For any questions or issues regarding your actual Pi Network account, mining, KYC, or official Pi Network policies, please refer to the support channels provided by the Pi Network (e.g., in-app support in the official Pi app, official Pi Network website and community channels).

legal.piosLicenseContent:
The Pi Open Source (PiOS) License allows Pi Community Developers to create Pi Apps and tools for the Pi Ecosystem. Developers are free to use the license to build on top of others’ work, and to get their creations used and built upon by others within the Pi Ecosystem.

The PiOS license grants unrestricted use of the software only within the Pi Ecosystem. Selling the software, or any software that incorporates PiOS-licensed software or its derivatives, for fiat currency is prohibited. Selling for Pi cryptocurrency is permitted. The license also explicitly prohibits use of the software to create any product that might be deemed to compete with Pi Network. 

Read the full license [here](https://github.com/pi-apps/PiOS/blob/main/LICENSE.md).
